oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Standardisierung der Steigbildmethode für die Unterscheidung von Proben aus verschiedener Herkunft
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kahl, J.
Zalecka, A.
Busscher, N.
Ploeger, A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Food security, food quality and human health
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: With the Steigbild technique patterns are produced on thin-layer chromatographic paper and evaluated as a fingerprint of the sample as a whole. To be applied in routine analysis the method has to be standardised according to international standard norms. The operating procedures were documented and a method for the visual evaluation was standardised. Then several factors of influence were tested and the reproducibility was investigated. The method is able to differentiate patterns from samples from different farming treatments and processing steps. Farm pairs of organic and conventional farm management can be distinguished as statistical significant and classified according to the farming system for carrot and wheat samples. This represents a significant step forward beyond the state of the art.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Kahl, J.; Zalecka, A.; Busscher, N. and Ploeger, A. (2009) Standardisierung der Steigbildmethode für die Unterscheidung von Proben aus verschiedener Herkunft. Paper at: 10. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Zürich, 11.-13. Februar 2009.
